channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2023090304
item.description:
Report E-2023090304

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-12
  • City: SIOUX CITY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of sanidate (un3109) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner poly 2.5 gallon jugs had been punctured and had released 2.5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023090039
item.description:
Report X-2023090039

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: DAVENPORT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT UNLOAD WITH PROPER PPE ON. RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAIN SPILL AND TRANSPORT TO DMP AREA. RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH DMP USING WASTE DISPOSAL CHART

item.title: Report X-2023081983
item.description:
Report X-2023081983

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: DAVENPORT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE SPILL WEARING ALL PPE AND USING RESPONSE SHEET. THEN PROCESSED THE SPILL THROUGH THE DMP UING THE WASTE DISPOSAL CHART AND DECSION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS

item.title: Report X-2023081214
item.description:
Report X-2023081214

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was sent as a previously damaged product. The inner contents were taped up to prevent any further leaking. The tape failed and allowed the contents to leak. DescribePack: Cracks and loose caps that had been poorly taped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic bag for the duration of the drivers route. Then it was returned to the station and placed into a plastic lined tote and separated from other package.

item.title: Report X-2023081143
item.description:
Report X-2023081143

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-12
  • City: OTTUMWA
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading the package was found to have a wet spot, it was placed in a tote and taken to QA for further process. DescribePack: It was found during the inspection that 2 of the jugs had vented caps. The package at some point was on it side causing some of the liquid to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed into a tote and taken to QA for further processing

item.title: Report X-2023081927
item.description:
Report X-2023081927

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: DUBUQUE
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was identified to be leaking internally during trailer unload operations. Package was segregated into a lined tote and set aside in the hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: Lid on the plastic bottles were not shut tightly. Liquid released through the lid that was not secured. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was segregated into a lined tote and set aside in the hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2023081215
item.description:
Report X-2023081215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer. Brought to QA leaking DescribePack: Liquid released from glass jugs. Leaked out of plastic bag that wasn't sealed at all. Soaked through corrugated cardboard box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in lined HazMat totes

item.title: Report X-2023081248
item.description:
Report X-2023081248

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unload manager found package leaking when he opened trailer door. he placed package in a red tote and taken to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: the lid was found popped off and contents leaking. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a red hazmat tote to contain the spill.
